required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radiotherapy Combined With Irinotecan and Apatinib Followed by PD-1 Antibody and Apatinib for Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Study to Evaluate Radiotherapy Combined With Irinotecan Liposome and Apatinib Followed by PD-1 Antibody and Apatinib for the Treatment of Advanced Solid Tumors That Failed Standard Treatments

lead_sponsor.agency: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

brief_summary.textblock: An exploratory study to evaluate for the treatment of advanced solid tumors that failed standard treatments.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, single-arm, observational study. After the subjects meet the inclusive and exclusive criteria, then they will receive radiotherapy combined with irinotecan liposome and apatinib followed by PD-1 antibody and apatinib.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluated by researchers based on the RECIST 1.1 standard

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by researchers based on the RECIST 1.1 standard
Evaluated by researchers based on the RECIST 1.1 standard

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between immune microenvironment parameters of target lesions and efficacy
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by researchers based on the RECIST 1.1 standard

arm_group.description: radiotherapy combined with irinotecan liposome and apatinib followed by PD-1 antibody and apatinib

intervention.description: radiotherapy combined with irinotecan liposome and apatinib followed by PD-1 antibody and apatinib
radiotherapy combined with irinotecan liposome and apatinib followed by PD-1 antibody and apatinib

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to make individual participant data (IPD) available to other researchers.
